sentences.sContent: Hang a hammock; lie in it.
sentences.sCn: 挂上一个吊床，然后躺在里面。

sentences.sContent: Many nights, I cried silently in my hammock, tears of self-pity streaming down my face.
sentences.sContent_eng: Many nights, I cried silently in my hammock, tears of self-pity streaming down my face.
sentences.sCn: 许多个晚上，我在吊床上静静地哭泣，自伤自怜的泪水顺着脸往下淌。

sentences.sContent: But when I started to read the journals that I'd written in my hammock each night, I realised that I'd been pretty miserable for large parts of the journey.
sentences.sContent_eng: But when I started to read the journals that I'd written in my hammock each night, I realised that I'd been pretty miserable for large parts of the journey.
sentences.sCn: 但是当我开始阅读在旅行中我每个夜晚在吊床上写下的文字时，我才意识到，在这次旅程的大部分时间里，我都是倍受折磨和煎熬的。

trans.tranOther: a large piece of cloth that is hung between two trees or posts so that you can sleep in it
